intro: Asperula eugeniae, commonly known as the Japanese evergreen azalea, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and prefers acidic soil conditions. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink and red, bloom in spring and early summer. Asperula eugeniae is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in partial shade.
